name: TV Sitcom Names Quiz | Mixture: Comedy | 10 Questions

questions.text: On "Happy Days", what was Potsie's real first name?
questions.explanation:
Warren.

	Played by Anson Williams, Warren "Potsie" Weber was Richie Cunningham's (Ron Howard) close friend.  "Happy Days" aired from 1974-1984.

questions.text: On "Diff'rent Strokes", what were the names of the three different housekeepers on the show?
questions.correct: Edna Garrett, Adelaide Brubaker, Pearl Gallagher
options: Adelaide Brubaker, Maggie Sinclair, Edna Garrett
Edna Garrett, Florida Evans, Maggie Sinclair
Pearl Gallagher, Edna Garrett, Maggie Sinclair
questions.explanation:
Edna Garrett, Adelaide Brubaker, Pearl Gallagher.

	This sitcom told the story of Phillip Drummond (Conrad Bains) and his daughter Kimberly (Dana Plato) and the two boys he adopted, Willis (Todd Bridges) and Arnold (Gary Coleman).

questions.text: On "The Courtship of Eddie's Father", who played their housekeeper Mrs. Livingstone?
questions.explanation:
Miyoshi Umeki.

	This sitcom was about single dad Tom Corbett (Bill Bixby) and his son Eddie (Brandon Cruz).  The show aired from 1969-1972.

questions.text: On "Charles in Charge", what was Charles' last name?
questions.explanation:
It was never revealed.

	This sitcom was about Charles (Scott Baio) a college student who was hired to care for a family of three kids.  From 1984-1985 he was in charge of the Pembrokes and from 1987-1990 he was in charge of the Powells.

questions.text: On "Gilligan's Island", what was Mrs. Howell's real name?
questions.explanation:
Eunice Wentworth Howell.

	Mrs. Howell (Natalie Schafer) was better known as Lovey to her hubby Thurston Howell III (Jim Backus).

questions.text: On "The Facts of Life" what was Tootie's real name?
questions.explanation:
Dorothy.

	This sitcom was about the girls at Eastland School.  Edna Garrett (Charlotte Rae) left her job as housekeeper for the Drummonds ("Diff'rent Strokes") and now was the head dietician and surrogate mom for the girls at Eastland.

questions.text: On "Dear John", what was John's last name?
questions.explanation:
Lacey.

	Judd Hirsch starred as John Lacey, a divorced man who finds himself joining a singles support group,  The "One-Two-One Club".

questions.text: On the show "Alice", what was Flo's last name?
questions.explanation:
Castleberry.

	This sitcom told the story of single mom Alice (Linda Lavin) and her life as a waitress at Mel's Diner.

questions.text: On "Chico and The Man", who played the role of Ed Brown?
questions.explanation:
Jack Albertson.

	"Chico and the Man" starred Freddie Prinze as Chico and Jack Albertson as "the man" (Ed Brown) in this sitcom about a garage owner and his employee.

questions.text: On "The Dick Van Dyke Show", who played Alan Brady?
questions.explanation:
Carl Reiner.

	Rob Petrie (Dick Van Dyke) was a husband, father and head writer for "The Alan Brady Show". Co-starring Mary Tyler Moore as his wife Laura.  This classic sitcom aired from 1961-1966.
